blocks.content:
**What you will learn:** Which panel type to pick for your data.

Each stop links to a live example on Grafana Play—click through and explore!
The bread and butter of monitoring—showing how things change over time.
**Time Series** — The workhorse. Use this when you want to see metrics over time—CPU usage, request rates, temperatures, you name it.
**State Timeline & Status History** — When you care about *what state* something was in, not just numbers. Perfect for tracking service status, deployments, or on/off states.
Sometimes you just need one big number that tells you what's happening *right now*.
**Stats** — Big numbers with optional sparklines. Use these when a single value tells the whole story: total users, current latency, error count.
**Gauges** — When you need to show how close a value is to a threshold. Think: disk usage at 87%, CPU approaching danger zone.
When you need to see the actual data, not just a pretty picture.
**Tables** — For when you need rows and columns. Great for top-N lists, detailed breakdowns, or any time you want to see exact values side by side.
Comparing things across categories or understanding how values are distributed.
**Bar Charts & Pie Charts** — Comparing categories. Bar charts for "which is bigger?", pie charts for "what's the proportion?"
**Histograms** — When you want to understand distribution. How are response times spread out? Where do most values fall?
More advanced panels for specific analytical needs.
**Heatmaps** — Visualizing density and patterns in two dimensions. Perfect for spotting "hot" time periods or understanding where values cluster.
**Candlestick** — The classic financial chart. Use it when you're tracking price movements, trades, or any data with open/high/low/close semantics.
Built for the unique needs of logs and performance profiling.
**Logs Panel** — For viewing log lines directly in your dashboard. Search, filter, and correlate logs alongside your metrics.
**Flame Graphs** — For performance profiling. See where your application is spending its time, function by function.
When location matters.
**Geomaps** — Plot your data on a map. Server locations, regional metrics, delivery routes—anything with latitude and longitude.
Helpers for building better dashboards.
**Text Panels** — Add context to your dashboards with markdown, HTML, or dynamic text. Great for instructions, links, or explanations.
**Dashboard List** — A panel that links to other dashboards. Build navigation hubs or group related dashboards together.
**Alert List** — Show active or recent alerts right in your dashboard. Keep an eye on what's firing without leaving the page.
When standard panels aren't enough—design your own.

**Canvas** — Your blank slate. Place shapes, icons, images, and metrics anywhere you want. Perfect for network diagrams, floor plans, custom status boards, or any layout that doesn't fit a traditional chart.
**What you have learned:** Grafana's panel library—each one designed for a specific job. Pick the right one, and your data tells its own story. Now go build something awesome!
